channel.title: War Report – Blogs
channel.description: Recent content in Blogs on War Report

item.title: Glossary
item.description:
A collection of frequently used Clash of Clans terms and abbreviations. It serves as a quick reference for both new and experienced players.

Term Definition
Alt Alternate account of a player
AQ Archer Queen
BH Builder Hall
BK Barbarian King
CC Clan Castle
CG Clan Games
CW Clan War
Charge One or more heroes are sent deep into the base to destroy key defenses or cc
Coco loon Single Balloon sent ahead to trigger seeking air mines before main air troops or Healers
CW Clan War
CWL Clan War League
DE Dark Elixir
Dip Higher Town Hall attacking a lower Town Hall in war
DPS Damage per second
Engineering Keeping some defenses low or missing to reduce war weight while upgrading offense
EQ Earthquake
F2P Free‑to‑play player who spends no real money
Farm (defence) Cluster of identical defenses such as Tesla farm or X‑Bow farm
Farm(ing) Playing mainly to gain resources instead of trophies
FC Friendly Challenge
Funnel(ling) Removing outside buildings so troops or heroes walk into the base instead of around it
Gemmer Player who progresses quickly by spending real money (gems)
Global chat Removed worldwide chat channel that previously matched random players and helped find clans
HP Hit points; total health of a troop or building
Island Defense surrounded by empty space so troops can’t reach it
Kill squad Small group of troops and heroes used to remove enemy Queen, Clan Castle, or key defenses at the beginning of an attack
Meta “Most Effective Tactics Available”; often used for the strongest attack strategies
Mirror Attacking the enemy base with the same map position number as your own in war
Nerf Balance change that makes a troop, spell, or defense weaker
Push Attacking to gain trophies and climb leagues
Rushing Upgrading the Town Hall before heroes, troops, buildings and walls are fully upgraded
Scout Attack used to reveal traps, pathing, and CC troops of a base
Skelly Donut Skeleton or bat spells with rage and invisibility to destroy multiple defenses and clan castle in the core of the base
Swag Dropping unnecessary spells/troops at the end of a guaranteed 3‑star to show overkill
Tag Unique ID starting with # used to identify a specific clan or player
Teaser base Base that exposes the Town Hall or major value to “bait” attackers into a trap‑heavy side
TH Town Hall
Tile Basic distance unit used for ranges and building sizes
Troll Tesla Hidden Tesla placed in an unexpected corner or outside tile to waste time or surprise attackers
WB Wall Breaker
Walk Queen and / or Grand Warden with Healers clearing mostly outside buildings and creating a funnel
War weight ”Strength” value of a base used for war matchmaking, driven by defenses, heroes, and troops

item.title: Events
item.description:
The following table provides an overview of the most important recurring events in Clash of Clans and their typical dates and times in UTC.

Event Frequency Date
Clan War Leagues Monthly Sign-up starts on 1st of the month (8:00AM UTC)
Clan Games Monthly 22nd - 28th (8:00AM UTC)
Gold Pass Season Monthly Season starts on 1st of the month (8:00AM UTC)
Legend League Monthly Season resets on the last Monday of the month (5:00AM UTC)
Ranked Leagues Weekly Sign-up starts on Monday (05:00AM UTC)
Raid Weekend Weekly From Friday to Monday (7:00AM UTC)
Trader Weekly Offers reset every Tuesday (8:00AM UTC)

item.title: How are Raid Weekend rewards calculated?
item.description:
Each destroyed district adds a reward based on its Capital Hall or District Hall level. The offensive reward can be calculated by adding up the rewards for completely destroyed districts, dividing this value by the number of attacks, and multiplying it by 6.

Capital Hall Level Reward
2 180
3 360
4 585
5 810
6 1115
7 1240
8 1260
9 1375
10 1450
District Hall Level Reward
1 135
2 225
3 350
4 405
5 460

Too difficult? Let War Report do the math for you.

item.title: How are Clan War League medals calculated?
item.description:
Medals from Clan War Leagues are split into base medals, which every roster player can earn, and bonus medals, which leaders can award at the end of the week.

Base medals depend on the league tier, the clan’s final placement, and the stars a player earns. Each player receives a percentage of the clan’s maximum medal payout based on their total stars across the 7 wars.

Medals for clan position

League 1st 2nd 3rd 4th 5th 6th 7th 8th
Unranked 0 0 0 0 0 0 0 0
Bronze League III 34 32 30 28 26 24 22 20
Bronze League II 46 44 42 40 38 36 34 32
Bronze League I 58 56 54 52 50 48 46 44
Silver League III 76 73 70 67 64 61 58 55
Silver League II 94 91 88 85 82 79 76 73
Silver League I 112 109 106 103 100 97 94 91
Gold League III 136 132 128 124 120 116 112 108
Gold League II 160 156 152 148 144 140 136 132
Gold League I 184 180 176 172 168 164 160 156
Crystal League III 214 209 204 199 194 189 184 179
Crystal League II 244 239 234 229 224 219 214 209
Crystal League I 274 269 264 259 254 249 244 239
Master League III 310 304 298 292 286 280 274 268
Master League II 346 340 334 328 322 316 310 304
Master League I 382 376 370 364 358 352 346 340
Champion League III 424 417 410 403 396 389 382 375
Champion League II 466 459 452 445 438 431 424 417
Champion League I 508 501 494 487 480 473 466 459

Bonus medals are tied directly to league tier and the number of wars your clan wins. Each tier has a guaranteed number of bonus slots with a fixed medal value per slot, and every war win adds one additional bonus slot on top of that guaranteed amount.

Bonus medals

League Medals per bonus Number of bonuses
Unranked 0 0
Bronze League III 35 1
Bronze League II 35 1
Bronze League I 35 1
Silver League III 35 1
Silver League II 40 1
Silver League I 45 1
Gold League III 50 2
Gold League II 55 2
Gold League I 60 2
Crystal League III 65 2
Crystal League II 70 2
Crystal League I 75 2
Master League III 80 3
Master League II 85 3
Master League I 90 3
Champion League III 95 4
Champion League II 100 4
Champion League I 105 4

Too difficult? Let War Report do the math for you.
